modules.description: This module provides a function `realize` that transforms a translation structure `GettextTypes.t` into a realized form `GettextTypes.t'`, typically resolving lazy or deferred components into their concrete values. It operates specifically on the translation data types defined in `GettextTypes`, which represent message catalogs and their entries. A concrete use case is finalizing a parsed `.mo` file's contents into an optimized, ready-to-use translation map at runtime.

Realizes localization data by converting a `GettextTypes.t` structure into a fully resolved `GettextTypes.t'`, typically used to load and prepare translation catalogs for runtime use. It operates on gettext translation structures, enabling concrete translation lookups by resolving references to message catalogs. This is essential when implementing multilingual applications that require dynamic loading of translations based on locale settings.

This module implements charset conversion between different text encodings. It works with strings and encoding names, providing a `create` function to set up a converter from an input to an output encoding, and `recode` to apply that conversion to a string. It is used when translating text between character sets, such as converting UTF-8 to ISO-8859-1 during message localization.

This module provides a single operation, `realize`, which transforms a `GettextTypes.t` value into a `GettextTypes.t'` value, typically by resolving or instantiating localized message data. It operates specifically on the abstract data types defined in the `GettextTypes` module, which represent internationalized message catalogs. A concrete use case is processing `.mo` file contents into usable message mappings during runtime in an internationalized application.

This module handles charset conversion and translation data realization. It provides functions to recode strings between encodings and to resolve gettext translation structures into usable forms. It works with strings, encoding names, and gettext message catalogs, supporting use cases like converting UTF-8 to ISO-8859-1 and finalizing `.mo` file contents for runtime translation lookups.
